actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 18, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Beyer moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9516.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 9516 — "To amend the Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act to provide for lifetime National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Passes for family members of members of the Armed Forces who lost their lives while serving their country."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3396.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3396 — "To require the standardization of reciprocal fire suppression cost share agreements, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8308.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8308 — "To reauthorize the Nutria Eradication and Control Act of 2003."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8931.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8931 — "To redesignate Saratoga National Historical Park as Saratoga National Battlefield Park."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8946.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 8946 — "To convey the reversionary interest of the United States in certain land in Sacramento, California."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3857.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3857 — "To take certain land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Jamul Indian Village of California, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8012.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8012 — "To establish the Jackie Robinson Ballpark National Commemorative Site in the State of Florida, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5401.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5401 — "To provide a one-time grant for the operation, security, and maintenance of the National September 11 Memorial & Museum at the World Trade Center to commemorate the events, and honor the victims, of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1351.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Guthrie moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1351 — "To study and prevent child abuse in youth residential programs, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 670.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Guthrie moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 670 — "To amend title IV of the Public Health Service Act to direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a clearinghouse on intellectual disabilities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4107.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Molinaro moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4107 — "To require Amtrak to report to Congress information on Amtrak compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 with respect to trains and stations."
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the Abundant Life Christian School tragedy.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 311
actions-list.actionItem: 96 (Roll no. 511).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1101 — "To amend the Lumbee Act of 1956."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 402
actions-list.actionItem: 12 (Roll no. 510).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3448 — "To reauthorize the Director of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum to support Holocaust education programs, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 210
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 198

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 115 — "To amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for "midnight rules", and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to recommit to H.R. 115, passage of H.R. 115, if ordered, and motions to suspend the rules.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1101.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1101 — "To amend the Lumbee Act of 1956."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6127.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6127 — "To provide for the standardization, consolidation, and publication of data relating to public outdoor recreational use of Federal waterways among Federal land and water management agencies, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7938.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 7938 — "To amend the Klamath Basin Water Supply Enhancement Act of 2000 to provide the Secretary of the Interior with certain authorities with respect to projects affecting the Klamath Basin watershed, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5355.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Foxx moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5355 — "To ensure that the National Advisory Council on Indian Education includes at least 1 member who is the president of a Tribal College or University."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1147.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Foxx moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1147 — "To amend the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to provide for grants in support of training and education to teachers and other school employees, students, and the community about how to prevent, recognize, respond to, and report child sexual abuse among primary and secondary school students."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3448.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Ms. Foxx moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3448 — "To reauthorize the Director of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum to support Holocaust education programs, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 115, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Biggs demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mrs. Ramirez moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 115.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 115 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Bill is closed to amendments.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1616. H.R. 115 — "To amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for "midnight rules", and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 212
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 207

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1616 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for "midnight rules'', and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 1616 and on agreeing to resolution, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1616, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1616.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1616 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 115) to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for "midnight rules'', and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Burgess to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House resumed Morning-Hour Debate.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 465, S. 5300, S. 5465, S. 5543, H.R. 4467, H.R. 7177, H.R. 7524, H.R. 8219, and H.R. 8413.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mariannette Miller-Meeks to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
